page.title: 03HOUSING IN GILWERN
page.content: Gilwern is one of the oldest villages in Gwent.One of the oldest houses date back to 1690. Some of the newer houses are to be found on the Crossroads and Malford Grove Estate. One road near Malford Grove is Winsford Grove.This road has large houses with medium-sized gardens.They have slated roofs and all the houses contain central heating.In the same area is Exford Grove.These are detached house,with semi-detached garages.At Lower Common, butterfly houses are to be found,which are quite rare.These are semi-detached houses with tiled roofs.Further down the road is Elm Grove.Here the houses are detached,with garages and medium sized gardens.Further along are the bungalows of Hillview.A little way up are the Brynglas and Dan y Bryn council estates.
